application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: Deterministic Symmetric Positive Semidefinite Matrix Completion

affiliation.orgName: Center for the Neural Basis of Cognition
Center for the Neural Basis of Cognition

analytic.title: Deterministic Symmetric Positive Semidefinite Matrix Completion

abstract.p: We consider the problem of recovering a symmetric, positive semidefinite (SPSD) matrix from a subset of its entries, possibly corrupted by noise. In contrast to previous matrix recovery work, we drop the assumption of a random sampling of entries in favor of a deterministic sampling of principal submatrices of the matrix. We develop a set of sufficient conditions for the recovery of a SPSD matrix from a set of its principal submatrices, present necessity results based on this set of conditions and develop an algorithm that can exactly recover a matrix when these conditions are met. The proposed algorithm is naturally generalized to the problem of noisy matrix recovery, and we provide a worst-case bound on reconstruction error for this scenario. Finally, we demonstrate the algorithm's utility on noiseless and noisy simulated datasets.
